name: Phishing Investigation
description: Standard investigation template for phishing email incidents. Use for suspicious emails, credential-harvesting pages, and spear-phishing campaigns.

tasks.title: Triage — Verify alert authenticity
tasks.description: Confirm the alert is not a false positive. Check if the sender domain is a known-bad domain and if the email was actually delivered.

tasks.title: Collect — Preserve email evidence
tasks.description: Save the original EML/MSG file with full headers. Extract and document: sender address, reply-to, X-Originating-IP, Message-ID.

tasks.title: Analyse — Sender domain reputation
tasks.description: Check sender domain/IP against VT, AbuseIPDB. Check domain creation date (recent = suspicious). Verify SPF/DKIM/DMARC alignment.

tasks.title: Analyse — URLs and attachments
tasks.description: Submit all URLs to VT and URLScan.io. Submit attachments to sandboxes (Any.Run, Hybrid Analysis). Document findings.

tasks.title: Contain — Identify affected users
tasks.description: Determine which users received/opened the email. Check mail gateway logs for delivery and click-through events.

tasks.title: Contain — Block at email gateway
tasks.description: Block sender domain/IP at email gateway. If a credential-harvesting URL was clicked, force password reset for affected users.

tasks.title: Remediate — User notification
tasks.description: Notify affected users. If credentials may have been captured, initiate password reset and MFA review.

tasks.title: Close — Document and close
tasks.description: Write closure summary. Submit IOCs to threat-intel platform. Mark false-positive classification if applicable.
